intro: Cyphostemma betiforme, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, waxy leaves and yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing along rocky outcrops and in scrublands. Its unique morphology and adaptation to harsh climates make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
